selected_quotes: Scientists still fail to record age and sex of lab mice, despite 2010 guidelines
Only 53% of research papers record both the sex age of animals used #reproducibility
Sex age of animals not always reported; doing so is necessary to improve #animalresearch

citation.title: Scientists still fail to record age and sex of lab mice

news.title: Make a Note
news.summary: In the years since the ARRIVE guidelines were developed in 2010 to standardize how animal studies are reported, researchers still don't frequently report the age and sex of lab mice used in their experiments, Nature News reports.

blogs.title: Research Mice Are Strongly Segregated By Sex
blogs.summary:
Earlier this week, when discussing the recently implemented National Institutes of Health (NIH) grant requirement that proposals cover how sex is accounted for as a biological variable, I commented on the length of time it has taken to get to this point.
